steps: There are two types of RGB Leds
The kit has the common cathode meaning the longest leg is negative
This means that the longest arm is connected to the negative
The kit has 5 pushbuttons
It is a momentary pushbutton meaning once pressed it goes to initial position
There are ten 220ohm resistors
Resistors have no polarity, thus no negative and positive side
The Light Dependent Resistor can detect presence or absence of light
It is has no polarity(no  negative or positive side)
The specific temperature sensor in this kit is TMP 36
The first pin goes to 5V Pin of the Unda xplora Kit
The second pin goes to any analog (A0 to A7)Pin of the Kit
The third pin goes to Ground Pin of the Unda xplora the Kit
The potentiometer has 3 pins
Pin one is connected to 5V pin on the kit.
Pin two is connected to any analog pin.
Pin three is connected to Ground (GND Pin)
Buzzer
The positive pin is longer than the negative pin
The motor is a DC Motor
It is has been connected to a diode already for easier connection.
The red wire is the positive pin and black is the negative pin.
Connect positive to digital pin and negative to ground pin.
There are various different sized  breadboarding jumper wires in the kit
Use them to make connections between components that are closer together
There are 10 different sized jumper wires
Use them to make connections between components that are far apart
Rechargable 9V Battery
There battery that acts as our power supply
Battery Connector Cable
Use the battery connector cable to power the kit
Battery Charging Cable
Use the type-C cable to charge the battery
